pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [23fd087d93](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18768/commits/23fd087d93cc1afc968c5d9bddb1deb2272f2291)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Quick note: you will need to document the new script in `scripts/README.md`; this is why the `lint-style` job is failing.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by adomani.

Let's try this!

bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11816222562/job/32919049298)

I like this very much!

I do not understand the subtleties of the python code, but, as far as I can tell, this is great!  My opinion is that this is ready to be tested!

I'll also try the

maintainer delegate

option from review!
The logic seems sensible (but I don't know the mechanics of working with zulip). Three small comments/suggestions.

I like this very much!

I do not understand the subtleties of the python code, but, as far as I can tell, this is great!  My opinion is that this is ready to be tested!

I'll also try the

maintainer delegate

option from review!
The logic seems sensible (but I don't know the mechanics of working with zulip). Three small comments/suggestions.

```suggestion
      uses: actions/setup-python@v5
```

Could you factor this script out into a separate file?

(Also, I guess you may already be aware, but secrets.ZULIP_EMAIL doesn't currently exist, we're just using `github-mathlib4-bot@leanprover.zulipchat.com` directly in our other scripts.)
Yep, I'll work on this asap

Not sure if this is the best way to do this, but presumably we'll want to filter out linkifiers pointing to other repos.
```suggestion
        pr_pattern = re.compile(r'(^|\s)#(\d{1,5})')
```
There's also the `!4#XXXXX` linkifier, but I think only the triage bot uses it (and only in the titles of threads).
I don't understand a large part of this script, but does it actually use the repository, or does it just access mathlib information online?

Thinking about this again, the script itself should be checked out!

Maybe you can do add a `sparse-checkout` flag to the action and just download the script itself, if that is really all that is needed by the action.

```suggestion
        python scripts/zulip_emoji_merge_delegate.py "$ZULIP_API_KEY" "$ZULIP_EMAIL" "$ZULIP_SITE" "$GITHUB_TOKEN"
```
I think that this is what actionlint is talking about.

```suggestion
# Fetch the last 200 messages
```
Is this a better description of what this command does?  I am just making a guess reading the code.
yeah, forgot to update the comment :facepalm:

This means that the bot will only react to messages that do not already have a reaction.  Would it be better to have the bot react *always*?  After all, when a maintainer merges a PR, they usually react with :merge: when they `bors merge` the PR, not when the PR is actually merged.  The bot reaction would be confirmation that the PR really got merged after all.
actually, maybe I should check for the `ready-to-merge` label, instead of `[Merged by bors]` in the title.
Wait, that answers a different question
Ok, that at least makes the two checks more consistent with one another!  :smile:
I pushed an update that answers your question as well
This description is now outdate: the number is wrong, and there's a third emoji --- right?
Optional: you could also have this *remove* a "delegated" reaction, right?
Refer to the workflow file for an example how these variables look? Right now, reading just that comment would leave me pretty clue-less.

pullRequest.title: chore: add Zulip emoji merge delegate workflow
